title: Social Cost of Greenhouse Gases: EPA SC-GHG Report
summary: Sera gazlarının sosyal maliyeti, atmosfere salınan gazların gelecekte yaratacağı çevresel ve ekonomik zararların bugünkü parasal değeridir. Bu çalışma, EPA'nın 2023 SC-GHG raporunu temel alarak, Türkiye özelinde Ankara ili için bir hesaplama sunmakta ve GreenAiriva’nın yenilikçi çözümleriyle sosyal maliyet azaltımına katkılarını analiz etmektedir.

title: Greenhouse Gas Concentrations in the Atmosphere and GreenAiriva’s Solution Approach
summary: Greenhouse gases such as CO₂, CH₄, and N₂O are rising to critical levels, threatening human health and climate stability. Traditional solutions like algae filters, ionization towers, and DAC remain limited in scope. GreenAiriva addresses this challenge by combining multi-layer adsorbent technology, real-time data analysis, and solar-powered operation. This system selectively captures high-impact pollutants, improves urban air quality, and provides a sustainable, innovative approach to climate action.
abstract: The continuous increase in atmospheric greenhouse gas concentrations, particularly carbon dioxide (CO₂ ~420 ppm), methane (CH₄ ~1.93 ppm), and nitrous oxide (N₂O ~0.335 ppm, GWP 273), poses a critical threat to global climate stability. Current mitigation strategies remain insufficient for urban-scale applications. GreenAiriva introduces a novel multi-layer adsorbent technology integrated with real-time data analytics and powered by solar energy. Early research demonstrates the potential of advanced adsorbents—such as COF-999 and Zeolite 13X for CO₂, MFM-300(Fe) for CH₄, and CaX zeolite molecular sieves for N₂O—in selectively reducing atmospheric concentrations. By directly addressing urban traffic- and industry-related emissions, GreenAiriva offers a scientifically grounded, scalable, and sustainable solution for urban air purification and global climate mitigation.
author: GreenAiriva R&D Team

title: Urban Air Crisis
summary: In cities, air pollution from PM, NOx, and greenhouse gases threatens health and climate. Solutions like algae filters, ionization towers, and DAC remain limited. GreenAiriva, powered by solar energy, targets multiple pollutants through multi-layer adsorbent technology and real-time data analysis. In doing so, it fills the gaps of existing technologies and offers an innovative, sustainable solution for urban air purification.
